instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
Hi Guys. 

Another Air :) 

PPBUS_G3H - 8.6v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS - 8.6v
PP3V42_G3H - 3.4v
P3V42G3H_SW - 8.2v

L7560 - 4.8v
L7520 - 5.2v

P3V3_S5_DRVH - 10v 
P5V_S4RS3_DRVH - 5.4

5V at L7520 means the board is turned on.
Check for voltage at other big coils; apart of L7520/60.

L7630 - 1.05v
L7430 - 1.2v
L7560 - 3.3v
L7520 - 5v
PP3v42 is 3.4v

The board doesn't have any liquid damage or corrosion but someone played around with the bios chip it was heated up but not taken out. The SMC looks good. I don't have a fan spin even though I have the needs voltages to power on. Also i checked for shorted lines i couldn't find anything wrong.  Maybe reprogramming the bios would help :)
I noticed on L7560 on pin 1 i have 5v and on pin 2 3.3v

Stop to check buck converter coils on incorrect pin!
ALWAYS measure DC voltage on the output (DC side), where the filter cap is placed.

No voltage at all at L7310/20?.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD comes on?

ALL_SYS_PWRGD  is 0.1
No voltage on :7310/20
The SMC I reflowed no change

You must get ALL_SYS_PWRGD first.
Remove Q8150 and check it again.
With removed Q8150 when measured on pic 4 ( ALL_SYS_PWRGD ) goes up to 3v and goes down again. Now CHGR_PHASE is going up and down also
1V5_S0 pulsing the same as other volatges?
1V5_S0 steady at 1.5v with Q8150 on the board and without Q8150 shows sometimes very quickly 1.5v and drops to 0v

Let Q8150 out of board.
Try starting in SMC bypass mode.
With  Q8150 of the board it triggers the power button pads for power but nothing happens just goes back to 3.3v

"it triggers the power button pads for power"
I said try SMC bypass, not just trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.
Even with SMC Bypass no change
Yes same  PLT_RESET_L  when I try to measure goes up and down right away

If someone else worked on it, you can expect missing components, or broken trace.
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

Morning :)

I was checking the S0 Enables and found that (P5VS0_EN) was missing and  R8187 was moving and saw that under the resistor the contact was broken. I just rewired it and it powered on. 

Thanks you for your help 2informaticos I really appreciate it ✌🖖
